sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SCHNEIDEMÜHL (Polish Pilaf a small town of Prussia, in the province of Posen, lies on the Cüddow, 45 miles north of Posen and 140 miles east by north of Berlin. It is a railway junction of some importance, carries on a trade in wood, grain, and potatoes, and possesses an iron foundry, several glass works and machine- shops, and other industrial establishments. In 1885 the population was 12,259, of whom 7700 were Protestants and about 1000 Poles.
